workingHard: We are working hard to get your instance up and running with BLU

bluSolo.securityGroup:
We require the following ports to be open: 22, 25, 80, 389, 8787, 9443, 8443, 50000, 50001, 443, 9300, 8100, 8099.
See how to create a security group video
Go to AWS site groups
bluSolo.mustAgree: You must agree to email communications to participate in this program.
bluSolo.chooseCloud: Choose the cloud where you want to deploy your BLU Acceleration for Cloud
bluSolo.title: BLU Acceleration for Cloud

intro.text: Designed to meet demands of the most sophisticated enterprises, BLU Acceleration for Cloud Solo brings advanced data warehousing and analytics to an individual user. With the Solo plan you provision a private, dedicated data analytics and warehouse for your personal use… on the cloud of your choice (AWS or SoftLayer). Regardless of which cloud provider you choose to host your BLU Acceleration for Cloud Solo you will enjoy the same benefits.
intro.item1: Use all of the capabilities: We held nothing back
intro.item2: Single user configuration to keep the cost down without sacrificing function
intro.item3: 10GB of compressed database storage should accommodate 50GB or even larger data sets
intro.item4: No charge for software. Only pay for your cloud resources
intro.item5: Seamlessly upgrade to one of the business plans when you need more users or larger data sets

launch.title: Launch BLU Acceleration for Cloud
launch.text1: To provision your private instance of BLU Acceleration for Cloud you will require either a SoftLayer or an AWS account. IBM software provided as part of the Solo plan is free of charges, however your account will be charged by the cloud provider for any cloud services you consume.
launch.text2: Kindly fill in your credentials of AWS or SoftLayer account in the following Cloudify Widget to have an instance of BLU Acceleration for Cloud Solo -Beta :

help.clusterName: You will use the cluster's name to identify which of your SoftLayer devices are part of this cluster.
help.locationId: You should select the location closest to your data source to achieve better data transfer rates
help.edition: You must purchase a BigInsights license before creating your cluster or use your own if you already have a valid license.
help.serverType: Dedicated BareMetal are single tenant physical servers while Virtual Servers are virtual machines on a multi-tenant environment. The deployment time for Dedicated BareMetal is significant higher compared to Virtual Servers.
help.maxInternalDrivers: This option defines the chassis size for your server. A larger chassis allows you to have more space for RAM and disks.
help.masterRam: The master node on a BigInsights cluster uses a significant amout of RAM. For a small cluster you can use 32GB but we recommend at least 96 GB for anything bigger.
help.dataRam: The data nodes on a BigInsights cluster don't rely as much on RAM storage
help.network: Currently we only support 1 Gbps network speed.
help.numberOfServers: You should have at least 3 data node servers for optimal performance.
help.maxInternalDrives: This option defines the chassis size for your server. A larger chassis allows you to have more space for RAM and disks.
help.operatingSystemDisk: Enabling RAID 1 provides a secondary hard drive for operating system data redundancy, this will improve system availability.
help.numberOfDataDisks: Having more disks per server allows you to store more data into your BigInsights cluster.
help.masterRaid: Enabling RAID 1 provides a secondary hard drive for operating system data redundacy, this will improve system availability.

blu.title: BLU Acceleration for Cloud
blu.tryHeader: Try BLU Acceleration for Cloud (Beta) directly in your web browser
blu.try: Try BLU Acceleration for Cloud using the Cloudify widget below. Evaluate a set of great data warehousing and analytics technologies directly from your browser at no cost. Just follow these simple steps:
blu.step1: Step 1: Click the Play button in the widget below. If you don’t see a widget, ensure that JavaScript is enabled and that you’re using a modern web browser.
blu.step2: Step 2: Instantaneously sign up for the trial through your Google ID or by providing your name and email in the pop up that appears.
blu.step3: Step 3: When your system is ready, the widget will show a Start BLU Acceleration link. Click this link to start your trial. You can safely ignore any certificate warnings. In the page that opens up, enter the Username and Password shown in the bottom right of the widget below.
blu.noteDetails: You are advised not to upload sensitive data during your free trial of BLU Acceleration for Cloud.
blu.trialEnds: When your trial period ends, continue using BLU Acceleration for Cloud using the Solo or Business plans.

failedPriceValidation.error: Validating data against Softlayer failed. It might mean Softlayer is unstable or the data we have is old
failedPriceValidation.action: Try again to eliminate the option it is Softlayer.
